shortdesc.ph: Select specific facial areas to adjust.

plentry.pd: (-1): Default value, indicates invalid area, beautification effect not applied.
(100): Head area, used to achieve smaller head effect. Range: [0, 100], default: 50. Higher values mean more noticeable adjustment.
(101): Forehead area, used to adjust hairline height. Range: [0, 100], default: 0. Higher values mean more noticeable adjustment.
(102): Face contour area, used to achieve slimming face effect. Range: [0, 100], default: 0. Higher values mean more noticeable adjustment.
(103): Face length area, used to elongate the face. Range: [-100, 100], default: 0. Larger absolute values mean more noticeable adjustment. Negative values indicate opposite direction.
(104): Face width area, used to achieve narrower face effect. Range: [0, 100], default: 0. Higher values mean more noticeable adjustment.
(105): Cheekbone area, used to adjust cheekbone width. Range: [0, 100], default: 0. Higher values mean more noticeable adjustment.
(106): Cheek area, used to adjust cheek width. Range: [0, 100], default: 0. Higher values mean more noticeable adjustment.
(107): Mandible area, used to adjust jawbone width. Range: [0, 100], default: 0. Higher values mean more noticeable adjustment.
(108): Chin area, used to adjust chin length. Range: [-100, 100], default: 0. Larger absolute values mean more noticeable adjustment. Negative values indicate opposite direction.
(200): Eye area, used to achieve bigger eyes effect. Range: [0, 100], default: 50. Higher values mean more noticeable adjustment.

(201): Eye distance area, used to adjust the distance between eyes. Range: [-100, 100], default: 0. Larger absolute values mean more noticeable adjustment. Negative values indicate opposite direction.
(202): Eye position area, used to adjust overall eye position. Range: [-100, 100], default: 0. Larger absolute values mean more noticeable adjustment. Negative values indicate opposite direction.
(203): Lower eyelid area, used to adjust lower eyelid shape. Range: [0, 100], default: 0. Higher values mean more noticeable adjustment.
(204): Pupil area, used to adjust pupil size. Range: [0, 100], default: 0. Higher values mean more noticeable adjustment.

(205): Inner eye corner area, used to adjust inner eye corner shape. Range: [-100, 100], default: 0. Larger absolute values mean more noticeable adjustment. Negative values indicate opposite direction.

(206): Outer eye corner area, used to adjust outer eye corner shape. Range: [-100, 100], default: 0. Larger absolute values mean more noticeable adjustment. Negative values indicate opposite direction.
(300): Nose length area, used to elongate the nose. Range: [-100, 100], default: 0. Larger absolute values mean more noticeable adjustment. Negative values indicate opposite direction.
(301): Nose width area, used to achieve slimmer nose effect. Range: [0, 100], default: 0. Higher values mean more noticeable slimming effect.
(302): Nasal wing area, used to adjust nasal wing width. Range: [0, 100], default: 10. Higher values mean more noticeable adjustment.
(303): Nose root area, used to adjust nose root height. Range: [0, 100], default: 0. Higher values mean more noticeable adjustment.
(304): Nose bridge area, used to adjust nose bridge height. Range: [0, 100], default: 50. Higher values mean more noticeable adjustment.
(305): Nose tip area, used to adjust nose tip shape. Range: [0, 100], default: 50. Higher values mean more noticeable adjustment.
(306): Overall nose area, used to uniformly adjust nose shape. Range: [-100, 100], default: 50. Larger absolute values mean more noticeable adjustment. Negative values indicate opposite direction.
(400): Mouth area, used to achieve larger mouth effect. Range: [-100, 100], default: 20. Larger absolute values mean more noticeable adjustment. Negative values indicate opposite direction.
(401): Mouth position area, used to adjust overall mouth position. Range: [0, 100], default: 0. Higher values mean more noticeable adjustment.
(402): Mouth smile area, used to adjust the degree of mouth corner lift. Range: [0, 1], default: 0. Higher values mean more noticeable adjustment.
(403): Lip shape area, used to adjust lip shape. Range: [0, 100], default: 0. Higher values mean more noticeable adjustment. v.4.6.0.

(500): Eyebrow position area, used to adjust overall eyebrow position. Range: [-100, 100], default: 0. Larger absolute values mean more noticeable adjustment. Negative values indicate opposite direction.
(501): Eyebrow thickness area, used to adjust eyebrow thickness. Range: [-100, 100], default: 0. Higher values mean more noticeable adjustment.
